page.title: 03ECOLOGY, DEEPCAR AND WORTLEY
page.content: The area has 5 main habitats: urban, farmland, woodland, river and heathland. Urban development has reduced natural habitats but{Green {Belt}restrictions are in force. {TREES:}Beech, oak, sweet chestnut, larch, birch, sycamore, ash, rowan, hazel. {VEGETATION:}Holly, hawthorn, butterburr, sweet cicely, bluebells, foxglove, hairy bitter-cress, blackberry, bilberry, gorse, broom, bracken, heather and wood rush. {BIRDLIFE:}Kingfisher, curlew, kestrel, skylark, lapwing, chaffinch, cuckoo, yellowhammer, fieldfare, redwing, woodcock, willow warbler, brambling, grey wagtail, tree and meadow pipit, tree creeper, snipe and pheasant. {ANIMALS:}Squirrel, badger, fox, deer. {INSECTS:}Butterflies: Meadow and wall brown, common blue; Grasshoppers.
